ab.title: Numbers 6
ab.l:
And
the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,

‘Speak
to the children of Israel, and say to them, “A man or a woman who makes a separation
to vow a vow, to be a nazarite, to separate from the drink of grape
wine before the Lord,

He shall separate himself from wine and strong drinks,
he shall not drink vinegar of wine or of strong drink,
and he shall not drink any juice of grapes, and
he shall not eat moist or dried grapes.

All the days of his naziritehood
he shall not eat anything that is made of the grapevine, of grape skin, and
even of |grape| stones.

All the days of the vow of his naziritehood
a razor shall not pass on his head — until the fulfilment of the days that
he separates himself to the Lord he shall be holy — to let the locks of the hair
of his head grow.

All the days that he separates himself to the Lord
he shall not come to the soul of a dead man.

For his father
and for his mother, for his brother and for his sister:
he shall not become unclean for them when, because the crown of his God
is on his head.

All the days of his naziritehood he is holy
to the Lord.

And if any dead man dies beside him
suddenly, and he has defiled the head of his naziritehood, then he shall shave his hair
of his head in the day of his cleansing: he shall shave it on the seventh day.

And on the eighth day he shall bring two turtledoves
or two young pigeons to the priest, to the door of the tent
of meeting.

And the priest shall do one for a sin offering and
one for a burnt offering, and he shall ask for atonement for him, because he sinned
by being with the soul of a dead person, and he shall consecrate
his head on that day.

And he shall separate to the Lord
the days of his naziritehood, and he shall bring a one-year-old lamb
for a guilt offering, and the first days shall fall because
his naziritehood became unclean.

And this is the teaching of the nazarite:
On the day of fulfilment of the days of his naziritehood he shall bring himself to the door of the tent
of meeting.

And a basket of unleavened cakes of fine flour mixed with oil and
unleavened flans anointed with oil, and their grain offering, and their drink offerings.

And the priest shall bring forward them before the Lord and
shall do his sin offering and his burnt offering.

And he shall offer the ram for a sacrifice of peace offerings to the Lord
with the basket of unleavened bread. The priest shall do his grain offering and
his drink offering.

And the nazarite shall shave
the head of his naziritehood at the door of the tent of meeting, and he shall take the
hair of his naziritehood of his head and put it on the fire which
is under the sacrifice of the peace offerings.

And the priest shall take the
cooked forearm of the ram and one unleavened cake out of the basket,
and one unleavened flan, and he shall put them on the hands of the
nazarite after he had shaved the hair of his naziritehood.

And the priest shall elevate them for a wave offering before the Lord.
It is holy for the priest with the breast of the wave offering and the thigh of the heave offering. And after that the nazarite shall drink wine.

This is the teaching of the nazarite who will vow his offering
to the Lord for his naziritehood beside of what his hand may attain.
According to his vow which he vows, so he shall do
after the teaching of his naziritehood.”’

And the Lord spoke to Moses,
saying,

‘Speak to Aaron and to his sons,
saying, “Thus you shall bless the children of Israel,
saying to them:

“May the Lord bless you and keep
you.

May the Lord make his face shine to you and
be gracious to you.

May the Lord raise his Providence
to you and give you peace.””

And they shall put
my name on the children of Israel, and I will bless them
all.’
